bibl.title: The Sonic Landscape of Karanis: Excavating the Sounds of a Village in Roman Egypt.
Karanis Revealed. Discovering the Past and Present of a Michigan Excavation in Egypt

bibl.note: Investigates the sonic environment of ancient Karanis: musical instruments and related artifacts, bronze bells, animal noises, etc. - See also: John Kannenberg, Listening to Karanis: The Mer-Wer Remix Project, ibidem, pp. 179-181, figg. 60-61.
bibl.seg: Terry G. Wilfong, The Sonic Landscape of Karanis: Excavating the Sounds of a Village in Roman Egypt.

Terry G. Wilfong (ed.), with the assistance of Andrew W.S. Ferrara, Karanis Revealed. Discovering the Past and Present of a Michigan Excavation in Egypt = Kelsey Museum Publication 7 (Ann Arbor, 2014) pp. 169-177, fig. 59.

Investigates the sonic environment of ancient Karanis: musical instruments and related artifacts, bronze bells, animal noises, etc. - See also: John Kannenberg, Listening to Karanis: The Mer-Wer Remix Project, ibidem, pp. 179-181, figg. 60-61.
